result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel Erland Lundgren

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Defendant Samuel Erland Lundgren appeared by zoom.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Samuel Erland Lundgren.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001344, 2022TR001345 tracking with 22CF132:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.   Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status hearing on December 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license   *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:18 PM Defendant Samuel Erland Lundgren in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address and phone. Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and did call the PD office but he is waiting to hear back.  
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant responds.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
